info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 22 at 12:21PM EDT until April 22 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 100 PM EDT FOR SOUTHERN MADISON...CENTRAL ORANGE...SOUTHEASTERN FAUQUIER AND CULPEPER COUNTIES... At 1220 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Culpeper, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Culpeper, Orange, Madison, Bealeton, Brightwood, Opal, Remington, Midland, Brandy Station, Oakpark, Verdiersville, Haywood, Locust Grove, Winston, Madison Mills, Cardova, Mitchells, Reva, Morrisville and Leon. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
